Articles.Content:
I've noticed that the crews I've sent out to my Mun station, who have been there awhile whilst I've done other things all look, well, you'd want to lock the knife draw and not look them straight in the eye if you had to go visit. They all twitch a bit and have these scary grins on their faces.

Is this normal?

Edited September 5, 2015 by Clipperride

I've noticed that the crews I've sent out to my Mun station, who have been there awhile whilst I've done other things all look, well, you'd want to lock the knife draw and not look them straight in the eye if you had to go visit. They all twitch a bit and have these scary grins on their faces.

Is this normal?

Yeah you probably want to ship a DeepFreeze freezer over to them so they can chill out and have a good nap.
You got a case of dat space psychosis on your hands...

He forgot the snacks...

omgomgomgomg

You forgot to pack teh snacks!!!
Make a crew rotation every few years. Problem solved.
Call the KSPCK, we've got a serious case of neglect on our hands!
They just need a little excitement. Adjust your PE to 3km.

Adjust it to 500 meters if your pilot is Valentina and don't tell her. She's an adrenaline junky and doesn't scare easy. If you're not drawing in the sand with your antenna while you orbit you're not low enough.

Thanks people. I've been half expecting, each time I check back with them, to find just one, slightly fatter Kerbal demanding more Chianti and fava beans!

Footnote - for some younger reader's see

http://mentalfloss.com/uk/movies/27139/the-hidden-meaning-of-the-silence-of-the-lambs-iconic-line

and for others. How can that have been 1991? Where's the time go etc etc etc.....

You got a case of dat space psychosis on your hands...

You mean....SPACE MADNESS?

Should be okay as long as there are no large red buttons within easy reach.
